author: jimmychu0807

author: jimmychu0807
content: just wonder if zkVM proof generation is not that possible, what is being proved shown in the https://ethproofs.org/ dashboard? I thought it was the block state + stf, no?

author: jimmychu0807
content: btw, what is your question about ssz?

author: _.x.senpai.x._
content: Nope I am the one from the call

author: _.x.senpai.x._
content: These are actually heavy GPUs they are running it on 4090, and I think we might be able to run it  if we give it several hours inside risczero.

author: _.x.senpai.x._
content:
they are actually executing evm blocks and generating execution payload, which is just one part of Beacon State Transition Function. 
You can look at https://github.com/succinctlabs/rsp. This is what exactly is being done in ethProofs.  RSP works with EthereumState containing account balances, contract storage, and bytecode.

author: _.x.senpai.x._
content:
So to summarize 
This is the entire Beacon STF, and process_execution_payload is whats happening in ethProofs. 
(If I am anywhere wrong someone please correct me)

author: _.x.senpai.x._
content: Work is going on around PQDevnet and 3sf-mini implementation for Lean Consensus , I wanted to benchmark the process_block https://github.com/ReamLabs/ream/blob/master/crates/common/consensus/lean/src/lib.rs#L43  function  inside Ream's Lean consensus crate.  Since there are no spec-tests data for pre and post state and block snappy files like we had for beacon states and beacon blocks https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-spec-tests/tree/master/tests/mainnet/electra , what would be the correct way to myself create mock data for Lean state and block in order to benchmark it inside zkVm?
